unnormalised: Tech Mahindra announced the launch of its new AI-powered software development platform, 'DevAI', at the NASSCOM Tech Summit in Mumbai today. The platform, designed to accelerate the software development lifecycle, promises a 30% reduction in development time and a 20% improvement in code quality, according to company officials. The launch event, held at the Jio World Convention Centre, saw attendance from over 500 industry leaders.
normalised: Tech Mahindra announced the launch of its new A-I-powered software development platform, 'DevA-I', at the N-A-S-S-C-O-M Tech Summit in Mumbai today. The platform, designed to accelerate the software development lifecycle, promises a thirty percent reduction in development time and a twenty percent improvement in code quality, according to company officials. The launch event, held at the Jio World Convention Centre, saw attendance from over five hundred industry leaders.

unnormalised: DevAI leverages machine learning algorithms to automate tasks such as code generation, testing, and debugging. The platform supports multiple programming languages including Java, Python, and C++, catering to a wide range of development needs. The initial version, DevAI 1.0, is available for enterprise customers starting 15/07/2024, with a subscription fee of Rs. 5,00,000 per year for a team of 10 developers.
normalised: DevA-I leverages machine learning algorithms to automate tasks such as code generation, testing, and debugging. The platform supports multiple programming languages including Java, Python, and C plus plus, catering to a wide range of development needs. The initial version, DevA-I one point zero, is available for enterprise customers starting fifteenth July two thousand and twenty four, with a subscription fee of rupees five hundred thousand per year for a team of ten developers.

unnormalised: The company claims DevAI integrates seamlessly with existing development tools and infrastructure, minimizing disruption for software teams. A key feature highlighted was the platform's ability to predict potential bugs and vulnerabilities, leading to more secure and robust applications. Beta testing results from TCS and Infosys showed positive feedback with a reported increase in developer productivity by 25%.
normalised: The company claims DevA-I integrates seamlessly with existing development tools and infrastructure, minimizing disruption for software teams. A key feature highlighted was the platform's ability to predict potential bugs and vulnerabilities, leading to more secure and robust applications. Beta testing results from T-C-S and Infosys showed positive feedback with a reported increase in developer productivity by twenty five percent.

unnormalised: Tech Mahindra's CEO, Mr. CP Gurnani, stated, "DevAI represents a significant leap forward in software development. Our goal is to empower developers with AI-driven tools to build high-quality software faster and more efficiently. We project a 100% ROI for companies that adopt DevAI in their software development processes, within 2 years."
normalised: Tech Mahindra's C-E-O, Mister C-P Gurnani, stated, "DevA-I represents a significant leap forward in software development. Our goal is to empower developers with A-I-driven tools to build high-quality software faster and more efficiently. We project a one hundred percent R-O-I for companies that adopt DevA-I in their software development processes, within two years."
